title: Commercial Door Hardware Engineer
full_description: DESCRIPTIONThe Commercial Door Hardware Engineer is responsible for submittals, coordination and detailing of door, frame and hardware packages for commercial construction projects.RESPONSIBILITIESReviews drawings and other documents to write and edit specifications for projects and coordinate compliance with project requirements, institutional guidelines, populous standards, technical conditions, acceptable standards, and existing laws, rules, regulations, and codesApply door hardware knowledgeRead hardware templatesPrepare detailed submittals and shop drawingsMake recommendations using expertise to manage riskParticipates in QA/QC reviews and checks on project documentsAssist Project Managers and Architects with material and system constructability analysisPerforms product researchAssist project designers with material selection and system researchProvide engineering support for fielded productsDevelops new specification sections as neededLift up to 50lbsPerform basic office duties, including typing, copying, emailing, etc.Communicate regularly and effectively as appropriateMaintain the standards, culture, and values of CML SecurityOther duties as assignedQUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLSHigh school diploma or GED required1-2 Years of related door hardware experience requiredDHI/ANSI/HMMA certifications preferredStrong skills in MS office, Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.Employment may be contingent upon successful completion of a background check and drug screen
